node.title: Uber Eats says customers can pick up their weed in Ontario
node.description: Delivery app customers in the Canadian province can now use it to order cannabis, although they must pick it up themselves.

node.title: Here's how much more you're paying for food and fuel

node.title: Ms. Holmes begins rebutting one of the prosecution’s key arguments.
node.description: Prosecutors said Theranos had lied about endorsements from pharmaceutical companies to land funding. Ms. Holmes testified that Theranos had indeed worked with drug makers.

node.title: Sean Parnell Suspends G.O.P. Senate Bid in Pennsylvania
node.description: Mr. Parnell, who was endorsed by Donald Trump in one of the highest-profile 2022 Senate races, had been accused by his estranged wife of spousal and child abuse.

node.title: Study Finds Lobsters Feel Pain, U.K. Lawmakers Expand Animal Welfare Bill to Include Them
node.description: The bill will grant greater protection to decapod crustaceans like shrimp and lobster and cephalopod molluscs which includes squid and octopus.

node.title: Woman Possibly Attacked, Killed by Her Own Dogs in Backyard: Police
node.description: The medical examiner listed her cause of death as "blunt force trauma of the neck with penetrating injuries and mechanical asphyxia."

node.title: 4 Young Black Men Exonerated in 1949 Florida Rape Case That Led to 2 Being Gunned Down
node.description: "We followed the evidence to see where it led us, and it led us to this moment," said a local state attorney who moved to have them exonerated.

node.title: Ron DeSantis Calls for Gas Tax Relief in Florida as GOP Hammers Biden on Inflation
node.description: According to the governor, the proposal will save the average Florida family $200 over a five or six month period.

node.title: Georgia's New Voter Map Gives GOP Projected Advantage in State, Congressional Races
node.description: Georgia's state lawmakers approved a redistricting plan that will give Republicans an advantage in nine out of 14 districts.

node.title: Vermont Senate OKs Allowing Mask Mandates, Asks for State of Emergency Amid Rise in Cases
node.description: While towns may now impose mask mandates, "...it would be more effective if we could have the entire state be covered," said Montpelier Mayor Anne Watson.

node.title: Calls for cats to be indoor-only rise in Queensland's north
node.description: Queensland wildlife carers and pet rehoming services are in one voice when it comes to restricting cats to be indoor-only, so will councils follow those in Victoria, SA, and the ACT?

node.description: Aboriginal communities in the Northern Territory are being challenged by a unique set of circumstances as residents are forced to stay in their homes for what could be weeks on end.

node.title: Judge allows Henry Ruggs to remain on house arrest in fatal crash case

node.title: Covid-19 summary: Date confirmed for next phase; 205 new community cases

node.description: Danieli Taralli are ultra-flaky versions of the classic Puglian bites.

node.description: On Thanksgiving, consider the multiple benefits of giving thanks.

node.title: How Fake News on Facebook Helped Fuel a Border Crisis in Europe

node.title: After 20 Years, Frank Stella Returns to Ground Zero

node.title: Nathan Johnson, Modernist Black Architect From Detroit, Dies at 96

node.title: How Dr. Fauci and Other Officials Withheld Information on China's Coronavirus Experiments
node.description: The reluctance of Dr. Fauci and other NIH officials to be forthcoming with information that could shed light on the origins of COVID-19 illustrates the old Watergate-era saw: The coverup is often worse than the crime.

node.title: Black Woman Shot in Back By White Cop Drops Charges After Mediation Session

node.description: Matthew Lanz, 22, is the younger brother of Austin William Lanz, who fatally stabbed a Pentagon police officer in August.

node.title: Free E-Bikes for Everyone!

node.title: I Live in Arkansas, Not Tel Aviv. Why Is My State Telling Me Not to Boycott Israel?
node.description: I publish The Arkansas Times. We refused to sign an anti-B.D.S. law because it violates our First Amendment rights.

node.title: $15 Minimum Wage for Federal Contractors to Start in January — Here's Who May See a Raise
node.description: The Department of Labor estimates half of the workers who will see a pay increase are women, 25 percent are Hispanic and 15 percent are Black.

node.description: "He tried to choke me out on a couch and I literally had to bite him [to get free]," she said in court. "He was strangling me."

node.title: Ex-Trump Lawyer Michael Cohen Ends Home Confinement, Takes Swipe at Former Boss
node.description: The disbarred lawyer was serving a three-year prison and home confinement sentence, and will now serve a three-year term of supervised release.

node.title: St. Louis, Omaha Newspapers Among Those Eyed for Purchase by Alden Capital Hedge Fund

node.title: Find the AFL draft prospect that would be perfect for your team

node.description: Several Australian politicians are fighting to block a Chinese official from Interpol's executive committee, fearing Beijing may use the crime fighting body to target political dissidents.

node.title: More disability carers expected to reject mandate than expected
node.description: More disability care workers than previously anticipated are now expected to be stood down next week once vaccine mandate is implemented.

node.title: Judge clears the "Groveland Four" — 72 years after false rape claim

node.title: Taylor Swift Earns Her Fourth No. 1 in 16 Months With New ‘Red’
node.description: “Red (Taylor’s Version)” had the equivalent of 605,000 sales in the United States. On next week’s album chart, Adele’s “30” is expected to reach or exceed one million sales.

node.description: Americans have been dealing with high gas prices, which averaged $3.409 per gallon on Monday.

node.title: Greg McMichael's Attorney Suggests Ahmaud Arbery's Actions Also to Blame For Death
node.description: Defense attorney referred to Arbery as a "recurring nighttime intruder" in her closing arguments and pointed fingers at Arbery for his own death.

node.title: Ex-Raider Henry Ruggs Avoids Jail Time After Missed Alcohol Test, Given 2 Ankle Monitors

node.title: How migration fraud works and ways to avoid visa scams in Australia

node.title: Tourists may have to pay to visit Cape York's tip

node.title: Working from home is here to stay. How will it change the face of Melbourne?

node.title: A federal anti-corruption commission was promised at the last election — now it may not happen before the next one

node.title: Getting a job with a proper wage is Olivia's 'greatest achievement'. But advocates say it shouldn't be that hard
node.description: The disability royal commission heard more than 50 per cent of people with disability of working age were unemployed in 2018. Advocates say it's time for change.

node.title: 300,000 workers to get raise after higher minimum wage kicks in
node.description: Federal contractors in 2022 must pay workers at least $15 an hour, boosting their average income by $3,000 per year.

node.title: The men pursued Arbery because ‘he was a Black man running down the street,’ the prosecutor says in summation.

node.title: U.S. Median Home Price Climbs Again to $359K, Midwest Sees Highest Growth in Sales

node.title: This pastor thinks it's 'anti-Christian' to back the religious discrimination bill
node.description: The religious discrimination bill is expected to be introduced into Parliament this week. These queer pastors question the bill's necessity, and worry about its consequences.

node.title: 'You've got to risk it for the biscuit': Is equity crowdfunding worth the risk?
node.description: First-time investors are pouring millions of dollars into unlisted start-ups and small-to-medium-sized businesses through online crowdfunding campaigns. But is it really a smart way to invest?

node.title: This expert says too many social media platforms are 'wild west-y' when it becomes to protecting women's safety

node.title: What's with all the bird flu outbreaks lately, and should we be worried?
node.description: The COVID-19 pandemic may have crushed seasonal flu to historically low levels, but another type of flu — avian influenza or bird flu — has shown no signs of slowing.

node.title: With a nod to Adele, Spotify did something many big tech companies don't, they listened
node.description: For years, Spotify ignored pleas from artists and customers to change one aspect of their streaming service. But when Adele spoke, the streaming giant listened.

node.title: Costello says RBA 'irresponsible' on rates, but who is responsible for housing affordability?
node.description: Australia's skyrocketing property market has seen house prices increase 22 per cent in 12 months. As Alan Kohler writes, there's no easy answer to housing affordability.

node.title: Will Australia follow Europe into a fourth COVID wave?
node.description: Europe is facing a fourth wave of COVID. As we watch on, it is reasonable to ask whether Australia will be confronted with the same fate, writes Raina MacIntyre.

node.title: Robert Bly, Poet Who Gave Rise to a Men’s Movement, Dies at 94
node.description: His most famous, and most controversial, work was “Iron John: A Book About Men,” which made a case that American men had grown soft and feminized. It made him a cultural phenomenon.

node.title: Utah Dominates Oregon, Upending Pac-12’s Playoff Hopes
node.description: The third-ranked Ducks fell on the road, the second loss for the Pac-12’s best team.
